content.title: Funeral Assistance Scheme (PBAOCWWB)
content.department: Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department
content.details: The 'Funeral Assistance' is a Welfare Scheme by the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Labour Department, Union Territory of Puducherry. Through this scheme, the Board may sanction an amount of ₹7,000/- to the nominees/dependents of the deceased Construction Worker towards funeral expenses. The applicant should be submitted within two months from the date of death of the Construction Worker.
benefits: Financial Assistance of ₹7,000/- credited within 7 days through DBT.
eligibility: The applicant should be the nominee/dependent of the deceased Construction Worker.
The Construction Worker should have been a citizen of India.
The deceased, in his/her lifetime, should have been registered as a Construction Worker with the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The deceased, in his/her lifetime, should have completed the age of 18 years.
The deceased, in his/her lifetime, should not have completed the age of 60 years during the preceding 12 months in the construction work.
The deceased, in his/her lifetime, should have contributed regularly to the fund.
The deceased, in his/her lifetime, should not have defaulted in payment of contribution to the Board for a continuous period of more than one year.
content.application_process: Offline. The nominee of the deceased should visit the Office of the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (Industrial Estate, Thattanchavady, Puducherry - 605 009) and obtain the prescribed format of the application form free of cost from the concerned authority exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
documents_required: Duly Filled and Signed Application Form.
Birth Certificate/Transfer Certificate/Doctor Certificate for Age Verification.
Experience Certificate to Be Obtained From a Registered Engineer/contractor/association/trade Union, Serving as Evidence of Being a Construction Worker.
Proof of Blood Group (Medical Health Card or Laboratory Certificate).
Family Particulars/status and Nomination Details of the Beneficiaries.
Certificate From the Revenue Department or Social Welfare Department or Anganwadi Officials of the Respective Area.

faqs.question: Is there a fee associated with the registration process, and what is it?
faqs.answer: Yes, there is a registration fee of ₹25/- at the time of enrollment and an annual subscription fee of ₹100/-. Additionally, the Board collects ₹300/- as a renewal fee once in three years.

faqs.question: What is the role of the inspectors under the Act in the registration process?
faqs.answer: Inspectors verify the authenticity of the registration and, upon approval by the Secretary (Board), enroll the concerned worker as a beneficiary of the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for submitting an application for 'Funeral Assistance' after the death of the Construction Worker?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted within two months from the date of death of the Construction Worker.

faqs.question: How long does it take for the financial assistance to be credited after the application is submitted?
faqs.answer: The financial assistance of ₹7,000/- is credited within 7 days through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: It's been more than two months since my husband, a registered construction worker, passed away. Can I still apply for the Funeral Assistance scheme?
faqs.answer: No, you cannot apply for the Funeral Assistance scheme if more than two months have passed since the date of the construction worker's death.

faqs.question: I don't have the original last subscription bill of my deceased brother. Can I still apply for the Funeral Assistance scheme on his behalf?
faqs.answer: While the original last subscription bill is listed as a required document, you can try reaching out to the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board to inquire about alternative options.

faqs.question: Can the application be submitted to any office of the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board?
faqs.answer: The given content specifies the office address for obtaining and submitting the forms, but it does not explicitly state whether it can be submitted to any office.

faqs.question: My father recently passed away, and I am his nominee. If I receive the Funeral Assistance, will it affect any other benefits I might be eligible for, such as the death benefit?
faqs.answer: No, receiving the Funeral Assistance will not affect your eligibility for other benefits offered by the Board.

faqs.question: I submitted my application for the Funeral Assistance a month ago, but I haven't received the money yet. What should I do?
faqs.answer: If you haven't received the Funeral Assistance within a reasonable timeframe, you can contact the Puducherry Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board to inquire about the status of your application.

faqs.question: Who is considered a dependent under the Funeral Assistance scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme defines dependents as the nominee mentioned in the registration form, spouse, and children (unmarried and unemployed) of the deceased construction worker.

faqs.question: My brother, a registered construction worker, passed away due to illness. Is his family still eligible for the Funeral Assistance scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the cause of death does not affect the eligibility for the Funeral Assistance scheme.

faqs.question: My uncle passed away a month and a half ago. We are still collecting some required documents for the application. Can we submit the application after the two-month deadline?
faqs.answer: The two-month deadline for submitting the application is strictly enforced.
